item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "It didn't matter in the end how old they had been, or that they were girls, but only that we had loved them, and that they hadn't heard us calling, still do not hear us, up here in the tree house, with our thinning hair and soft bellies, calling them out of those rooms where they went to be alone for all time, alone in suicide, which is deeper than death, and where we will never find the pieces to put them back together." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Basically what we have here is a dreamer. Somebody out of touch with reality. When she jumped, she probably thought she'd fly" -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are." -- José Saramago

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Men are all the same, they think that because they came out of the belly of a woman they know all there is to know about women." -- José Saramago

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Stephanie Pearl-McPhee
item.description: "The best reason for a knitter to marry is that you can't teach the cat to be impressed when you finish a lace scarf." -- Stephanie Pearl-McPhee

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Amanda Boyden
item.description: "Remember, this is important: Never trust that you will be saved by anyone." -- Amanda Boyden

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I don't believe in colleges and universities. I believe in libraries because most students don't have any money. When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money. I couldn't go to college, so I went to the library three days a week for 10 years." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by J.W. Eagan
item.description: "Never judge a book by its movie." -- J.W. Eagan

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Shilpi Somaya Gowda
item.description: "Survival rates for breast cancer are relatively good, but Krishnan has been around illness enough to know there is usually a cruel injustice about the way it strikes. Cranky patients defy the odds, while the kind ones, the ones who bake him cookies or bring him tomatoes from their garden, always seem to die early. Mortality rates utilize the law of averages without consideration for who is most deserving." -- Shilpi Somaya Gowda

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Shilpi Somaya Gowda
item.description: "Or does she still come here simply because it's become a habit, like a scar etched onto her body, one that she can't help but think about, scratch at, pick at, all the while hoping it will miraculously heal one day?" -- Shilpi Somaya Gowda

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Jimmy McDonough
item.description:
"-You don't like confrontation? Sometimes I'm really down for confrontation. It's kind of like a changing thing. I don't know why.
Must be something that makes me differentiate between things I want to be straight-ahead about, and things that I DON'T want to be straight-ahead about. I think that most people have that mechanism. But some people handle it differently- they just go, "Well, this is something I don't wanna do that I gotta do." Some people think, "This is something I don't wanna do that I'm gonna do- but kinda half-assed." I think I fall into THAT category, heh heh heh." -- Jimmy McDonough

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Whatever comes," she said, "cannot alter one thing. If I am a princess in rags and tatters, I can be a princess inside. It would be easy to be a princess if I were dressed in cloth of gold, but it is a great deal more of a triumph to be one all the time when no one knows it." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "If nature has made you for a giver, your hands are born open, and so is your heart; and though there may be times when your hands are empty, your heart is always full, and you can give things out of that--warm things, kind things, sweet things--help and comfort and laughter--and sometimes gay, kind laughter is the best help of all." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "I am a princess. All girls are. Even if they live in tiny old attics. Even if they dress in rags, even if they aren’t pretty, or smart, or young. They’re still princesses." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Hang in there. It is astonishing how short a time it can take for very wonderful things to happen." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "What you have to do with your mind, when your body is miserable, is to make it think of something else." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: MaryJean add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Perhaps you can feel if you can’t hear,” was her fancy. “Perhaps kind thoughts reach people somehow, even through windows and doors and walls. Perhaps you feel a little warm and comforted, and don’t know why, when I am standing here in the cold and hoping you will get well and happy again." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett
